class.rdfs:comment: Any condition of the human body that affects the normal functioning of a person, whether physically or mentally. Includes diseases, injuries, disabilities, disorders, syndromes, etc.
class.rdfs:label: MedicalCondition

schema:associatedAnatomy.rdfs:comment: The anatomy of the underlying organ system or structures associated with this entity.
schema:associatedAnatomy.rdfs:label: associatedAnatomy

schema:cause.rdfs:comment: Specifying a cause of something in general. e.g in medicine , one of the causative agent(s) that are most directly responsible for the pathophysiologic process that eventually results in the occurrence.
schema:cause.rdfs:label: cause

schema:differentialDiagnosis.rdfs:comment: One of a set of differential diagnoses for the condition. Specifically, a closely-related or competing diagnosis typically considered later in the cognitive process whereby this medical condition is distinguished from others most likely responsible for a similar collection of signs and symptoms to reach the most parsimonious diagnosis or diagnoses in a patient.
schema:differentialDiagnosis.rdfs:label: differentialDiagnosis

schema:drug.rdfs:comment: Specifying a drug or medicine used in a medication procedure
schema:drug.rdfs:label: drug

schema:epidemiology.rdfs:comment: The characteristics of associated patients, such as age, gender, race etc.
schema:epidemiology.rdfs:label: epidemiology

schema:expectedPrognosis.rdfs:comment: The likely outcome in either the short term or long term of the medical condition.
schema:expectedPrognosis.rdfs:label: expectedPrognosis

schema:naturalProgression.rdfs:comment: The expected progression of the condition if it is not treated and allowed to progress naturally.
schema:naturalProgression.rdfs:label: naturalProgression

schema:pathophysiology.rdfs:comment: Changes in the normal mechanical, physical, and biochemical functions that are associated with this activity or condition.
schema:pathophysiology.rdfs:label: pathophysiology

schema:possibleComplication.rdfs:comment: A possible unexpected and unfavorable evolution of a medical condition. Complications may include worsening of the signs or symptoms of the disease, extension of the condition to other organ systems, etc.
schema:possibleComplication.rdfs:label: possibleComplication

schema:possibleTreatment.rdfs:comment: A possible treatment to address this condition, sign or symptom.
schema:possibleTreatment.rdfs:label: possibleTreatment

schema:primaryPrevention.rdfs:comment: A preventative therapy used to prevent an initial occurrence of the medical condition, such as vaccination.
schema:primaryPrevention.rdfs:label: primaryPrevention

schema:riskFactor.rdfs:comment: A modifiable or non-modifiable factor that increases the risk of a patient contracting this condition, e.g. age,  coexisting condition.
schema:riskFactor.rdfs:label: riskFactor

schema:secondaryPrevention.rdfs:comment: A preventative therapy used to prevent reoccurrence of the medical condition after an initial episode of the condition.
schema:secondaryPrevention.rdfs:label: secondaryPrevention

schema:signOrSymptom.rdfs:comment: A sign or symptom of this condition. Signs are objective or physically observable manifestations of the medical condition while symptoms are the subjective experience of the medical condition.
schema:signOrSymptom.rdfs:label: signOrSymptom

schema:stage.rdfs:comment: The stage of the condition, if applicable.
schema:stage.rdfs:label: stage

schema:subtype.rdfs:comment: A more specific type of the condition, where applicable, for example 'Type 1 Diabetes', 'Type 2 Diabetes', or 'Gestational Diabetes' for Diabetes.
schema:subtype.rdfs:label: subtype

schema:typicalTest.rdfs:comment: A medical test typically performed given this condition.
schema:typicalTest.rdfs:label: typicalTest
